public class KAryTree<E>
extends ArrayListTree<E>

This tree allows addition of at most k-children to any parent

Author:
Gaurav Saxena

Method Detail

add

public boolean add(E parent,
                   E child)
            throws NodeNotFoundException
Description copied from interface: Tree
In case an equal object is already present in the tree then the method returns false and the original object is not replaced.

Specified by:
add in interface Tree<E>
Overrides:
add in class ArrayListTree<E>
Parameters:
parent - object to which child object needs to be added. Parent is allowed to be null only when there are no other nodes present in the tree. In that case, the child will be added as root
child - object
Returns:
true if parent was found and child is not already in the tree, otherwise false
Throws:
NodeNotFoundException - if parent is not found

child

public E child(E parent,
               int index)
        throws NodeNotFoundException
Parameters:
parent - the parent node
index - index of child requested
Returns:
child present at index among the children of e, if the index is less than number of children of e, null otherwise
Throws:
NodeNotFoundException
